intro: Lippia javanica, commonly known as Java mint, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its aromatic and medicinal properties. Lippia javanica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions.
